docs.lead_paragraph: Hot Springs is a history-lover's dream. Over the years, visitors to this city of 35,000 in central Arkansas have ranged from baseball stars to notorious gangsters, all drawn by one thing: the naturally occurring warm mineral water that gives the area its name.

docs.snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio says he is a fan, but he was not among the 4.8 million visitors the park attracted last year. In fact, he has never been there....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio says he is a fan, but he was not among the 4.8 million visitors the park attracted last year. In fact, he has never been there.
docs.abstract: Mayor Bill de Blasio has yet to visit New York City's High Line park, which attracted some 4.8 million visitors in 2013; absence is in stark contrast to predecessor Michael R Bloomberg, who championed park and poured millions of his own dollars into it; park has attracted string of luxury buildings to Manhattan's Far West Side and is perhaps a symbol of the gentrification that de Blasio has so consistently denounced.

headline.main: High Line Draws Millions, but de Blasio Isn’t One
headline.print_headline: High Line Draws Millions, but the Mayor Isn’t One

docs.abstract: What communities are you a part of? Which one matters to you most? What do people need to know about this community? How can you communicate that? Here are some ideas for projects for teachers and students that help answer those questions, in honor of Connected Educator Month and the Oct. 20 National Day on Writing.

headline.main: 10 Ways to Explore and Express What Makes Your Community Unique

docs.snippet: Thomas E. Duncan, the first Ebola patient to develop symptoms in the U.S., is in serious but stable condition....
docs.lead_paragraph: Thomas E. Duncan, the first Ebola patient to develop symptoms in the U.S., is in serious but stable condition.
docs.abstract: Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital in Dallas initially failed to isolate Thomas E Duncan, traveler from Liberia who showed symptoms of the Ebola virus, and he may have come into contact with 12 to 18 people; Duncan is in critical but stable condition, and the people he came into contact with when he was experiencing active symptoms are being monitored.

headline.main: U.S. Patient Aided Ebola Victim in Liberia
headline.print_headline: Scrutiny in Texas to Detect Whether Ebola Spread

byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Dallas, and Norimitsu Onishi from Monrovia, Liberia. Reporting was contributed by Pamela Kripke from Dallas; Helene Cooper from Monrovia; Viv Bernstein from Kannapolis, N.C.; and Diantha Parker, Marc Santora and Timothy Williams from New York.
byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and NORIMITSU ONISHI
